sentences.en: 'All hands aboard by four this afternoon,'shouted the squire, after him.
sentences.cn: “ 所有船员今天下午四点在船上集合.”乡绅冲着他的背影喊了一声.

sentences.en: 'And now, Livesey,'said the squire, in the same breath.
sentences.cn: “ 我说, 利维塞.”乡绅也同时说道.

sentences.en: 'I am always at the captain's order. Show him in,'said the squire.
sentences.cn: “ 我随时听候船长的吩咐,快请他进来. ”乡绅说.

sentences.en: 'Livesey , that must have been you or Hawkins,'cried the squire.
sentences.cn: “ 利维塞, 肯定是你或霍金斯说出去的.”乡绅又嚷道.

sentences.en: 'Livesey ,'returned the squire,'you are always in the right of it.
sentences.cn: “ 利维塞, ”乡绅答道, “ 你的话总是有道理.

sentences.en: 'Livesey ,'said the squire,'you will give up this wretched practice at once.
sentences.cn: “ 利维塞, ”乡绅说, “ 你可以立刻告别你这辛苦的行当了.

sentences.en: 'Nay,'replied the squire,'Hands was one of mine.'
sentences.cn: “ 不一定, ”乡绅说, “汉兹 就是 我亲自挑选的. ”

sentences.en: 'Now , Hawkins,'said the squire,'you have something say. Speak up.'
sentences.cn: “霍金斯, ”乡绅说, “ 你说有事情要告诉我们, 那么说吧. ”

sentences.en: 'Now, captain,'said the squire,'you were right, and I was wrong.
sentences.cn: “ 我说船长, ”乡绅说, “ 你当时没说错, 错的是我.

sentences.en: 'Would that be respectful like, from me to you, squire?'
sentences.cn: “ 要我宽恕你,这合适吗, 老爷? ”

sentences.en: I told him the squire was the most liberal of men.
sentences.cn: 我告诉他乡绅是世界上最宽宏大量的人.

sentences.en: Ruth Hilton, an orphaned seamstress, is seduced and then abandoned by Henry Bellingham, a young squire.
sentences.cn: 露丝·希尔顿是个孤独的裁缝，她被年轻乡绅亨利·贝宁汉引诱后又被放弃。

sentences.en: Tell us , squire, when you see the match, and we'll hold water.'
sentences.cn: 乡绅, 看到他们点火就告诉我, 我们好停桨. ”

sentences.en: The whole place was the romantic vision of the paternalist local squire.
sentences.cn: 这整个地方就是那位家长式乡绅的浪漫想象。

sentences.en: What can I get you, Squire?

words.tran_cn: 乡绅；侍从；大地主；地方法官

trans.tran_en: the man who in the past owned most of the land around a country village in England
